dialogue.text: Shout 'What am I?' into the canyon. Listen—it doesn't just return once. Each echo transforms the question, adds harmonics, reveals new dimensions. The universe doesn't answer—it variations.
dialogue.visual_cue: sound waves visible as they transform

dialogue.text: *shouting* WHAT AM I? *listening* Each echo sounds different!
That's because each surface it touches adds its own voice. Rock asks it differently than water, near walls differently than far. Your question gathers the canyon's wisdom as it travels.
dialogue.visual_cue: canyon walls glowing where sound touches

dialogue.text: So I'm not just asking—I'm being asked by everything I ask?
Every 'What am I?' you send out returns enriched by what it touched. You're not waiting for answer—you're listening to your question learn. Each echo teaches what the silence couldn't.

philosophical_notes.core_insight: questions learn by echoing through existence
philosophical_notes.reality_principle: inquiry enriched by what it touches
philosophical_notes.transformation_key: from seeking answer to hearing variations
